definitionList.name: HANDOVER REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the source NG-RAN
node to the target NG-RAN node to request the preparation of resources for a handover.
definitionList.direction: Direction: source NG-RAN node → target NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the source NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Target Cell Global ID
elementList.description: Includes either an E-UTRA CGI or an NR CGI

elementList.name: NG-C UE associated Signalling reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the AMF on the source NG-C connection.

elementList.name: Signalling TNL association address at source NG-C side
elementList.description: This IE indicates the AMF’s IP address of the SCTP association used at the source NG-C interface instance.

elementList.name: PDU Session Resources To Be Setup List
elementList.description: Similar to NG-C signalling, containing UL tunnel information per PDU Session Resource; and in addition, the source side QoS flow Û DRB mapping

elementList.name: RRC Context
elementList.description: Either includes the HandoverPreparationInformation message as defined in subclause 10.2.2. of TS 36.331 [14], if the target NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, or the HandoverPreparationInformation message as defined in subclause 11.2.2 of TS 38.331 [10], if the target NG-RAN node is a gNB.

elementList.name: Location Reporting Information
elementList.description: Includes the necessary parameters for location reporting.

elementList.name: UE Context Reference at the S-NG-RAN node

definitionList.name: HANDOVER REQUEST ACKNOWLEDGE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the target NG-RAN
node to inform the source NG-RAN node about the prepared resources at the
target.
definitionList.direction: Direction: target NG-RAN node → source NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the target NG-RAN node

elementList.name: PDU Session Resources Not Admitted List
Target NG-RAN node To Source NG-RAN node Transparent Container
elementList.description: Either includes the HandoverCommand message as defined in subclause 10.2.2 of TS 36.331 [14] , if the target NG-RAN node is an ng-eNB, or the HandoverCommand message as defined in subclause 11.2.2 of TS 38.331 [10], if the target NG-RAN node is a gNB.

definitionList.name: HANDOVER PREPARATION FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the target NG-RAN
node to inform the source NG-RAN node that the Handover Preparation has failed.
definitionList.direction: Direction: target NG-RAN node → source NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source NG-RAN node

definitionList.name: SN STATUS TRANSFER
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the source NG-RAN
node to the target NG-RAN node to transfer the uplink/downlink PDCP SN and HFN status during a handover.
definitionList.direction: Direction: source NG-RAN node → target NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the source NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the target NG-RAN node

elementList.name: DRBs Subject To Status Transfer List

definitionList.name: UE CONTEXT RELEASE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the target NG-RAN
node to the source NG-RAN node to indicate that resources can be released.
definitionList.direction: Direction: target NG-RAN node → source NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the source NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated for handover at the target NG-RAN node.

definitionList.name: HANDOVER CANCEL
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the source NG-RAN
node to the target NG-RAN node to cancel an ongoing handover.
definitionList.direction: Direction: source NG-RAN node → target NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Source NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the source NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Target NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the target NG-RAN node

definitionList.name: RAN PAGING
descriptionList: This message is sent by the NG-RAN node1 to NG-RAN node2 to page a UE.

elementList.name: Index Length-10
elementList.description: Coded as specified in TS 38.304 [33].

definitionList.name: RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT REQUEST
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the new NG-RAN node
to request the old NG-RAN node to transfer the UE Context to the new NG-RAN.
definitionList.direction: Direction: new NG-RAN node → old NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: New NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the new NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Integrity protection
elementList.description: ShortMAC-I either contained in the RRCConnection ResumeRequest message as defined in TS 38.331 [10]) or in the RRCConnection ResumeRequest message as defined in TS 36.331 [14])

elementList.name: New Cell Identifier
elementList.description: The Cell Identifier of the cell where the RRC connection has been requested to be resumed or to be re-established.

elementList.name: RRC Resume Cause
elementList.description: In case of RNA Update, contains the cause value provided by the UE in the RRC ResumeRequest message, as defined in TS 38.331 [10], or in the RRCConnection ResumeRequest message, as defined in TS 36.331 [14].

definitionList.name: RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT RESPONSE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the old NG-RAN node
to transfer the UE context to the new NG-RAN node.
definitionList.direction: Direction: old NG-RAN node → new NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: New NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the new NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the old NG-RAN node

elementList.name: UE Context Information Retrieve UE Context Response
Location Reporting Information
elementList.description: Includes the necessary parameters for location reporting.

definitionList.name: RETRIEVE UE CONTEXT FAILURE
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the old NG-RAN node
to inform the new NG-RAN node that the Retrieve UE Context procedure has
failed.
definitionList.direction: Direction: old NG-RAN node → new NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: New NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the new NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Old NG-RAN node To New NG-RAN node Resume Container
elementList.description: Includes either the RRCRelease message as defined in TS 38.331 [10], or the RRCConnectionRelease message as defined in TS 36.331 [14], encapsulated in a PDCP-C PDU.

definitionList.name: DATA FORWARDING ADDRESS INDICATION
descriptionList:
This message is sent by the new NG-RAN node
to transfer data forwarding information to the new NG-RAN node.
definitionList.direction: Direction: new NG-RAN node → old NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: New NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the new NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Old NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID reference
elementList.description: Allocated at the old NG-RAN node

elementList.name: Data Forwarding Info per PDU Session Resources
Data Forwarding Info per PDU Session Resources Item

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of PDU sessions. Value is 256

resources for dual connectivity operation for a
specific UE.

elementList.description: The UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate is split into M-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate and S-NG-RAN node UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate which are enforced by M-NG-RAN node and S-NG-RAN node respectively.

elementList.name: Selected PLMN
elementList.description: The selected PLMN of the SCG in the S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Mobility Restriction List
elementList.description: This IE may need to be refined.

elementList.description: Includes the CG-ConfigInfo message as defined in subclause 11.2.2 of TS 38.331 [10] or the SCG-ConfigInfo message as defined in subclause 10.2.2 of TS 36.331 [14].

elementList.name: S-NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
elementList.description: Allocated at the S-NG-RAN node

definitionList.name: DRBs Subject To Status Transfer List
descriptionList:
This IE contains a list of DRBs containing
information about PDCP PDU transfer status.

elementList.name: DRBs Subject To Status Transfer Item
Receive Status Of PDCP SDU
elementList.description: The IE is used in case of 12-bit long PDCP-SN. The first bit indicates the status of the SDU after the First Missing UL PDCP SDU. The Nth bit indicates the status of the UL PDCP SDU in position (N + First Missing SDU Number) modulo (1 + the maximum value of the PDCP-SN). 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly.

elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number that the target NG-RAN node should assign for the next DL SDU not having an SN yet in case of 12-bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: Receive Status Of PDCP SDU
elementList.description: The IE is used in case of 18-bit long PDCP-SN. The first bit indicates the status of the SDU after the First Missing UL PDCP SDU. The Nth bit indicates the status of the UL PDCP SDU in position (N + First Missing SDU Number) modulo (1 + the maximum value of the PDCP-SN). 0: PDCP SDU has not been received. 1: PDCP SDU has been received correctly.

elementList.name: UL COUNT Value
elementList.reference: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18 9.2.3.37
elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number of the first missing UL SDU in case of 18-bit long PDCP-SN

elementList.name: DL COUNT Value

elementList.description: PDCP-SN and Hyper Frame Number that the target NG-RAN node should assign for the next DL SDU not having an SN yet in case of 18-bit long PDCP-SN

definitionList.name: Global gNB ID
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to globally identify a gNB (see TS 38.300 [9]).

elementList.name: gNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE contained in the NR CGI IE of each cell served by the gNB.

definitionList.name: Global ng-eNB ID
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to globally identify an ng-eNB (see TS 38.300 [9]).

elementList.name: Macro ng-eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 20 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

elementList.name: Short Macro ng-eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 18 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

elementList.name: Long Macro ng-eNB ID
elementList.description: Equal to the 21 leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE contained in the E-UTRA CGI IE of each cell served by the ng-eNB.

definitionList.name: Global NG-RAN Node ID
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to globally identify an NG-RAN node (see TS 38.300 [9]).

definitionList.name: PLMN Identity
descriptionList: This IE indicates the PLMN Identity.

elementList.name: PLMN Identity
elementList.description: Digits 0 to 9 encoded 0000 to 1001, 1111 used as filler digit. Two digits per octet: - bits 4 to 1 of octet n encoding digit 2n-1 - bits 8 to 5 of octet n encoding digit 2n PLMN Identity consists of 3 digits from MCC followed by either: - a filler digit plus 2 digits from MNC (in case of 2 digit MNC) or - 3 digits from MNC (in case of 3 digit MNC).

definitionList.name: TAC
descriptionList:
This
information element is used to uniquely identify a Tracking Area within a PLMN.

definitionList.name: RAN Area Code
descriptionList: This IE defines the RAN Area Code.

definitionList.name: NR CGI
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to globally identify an NR cell (see TS 38.300 [9]).

elementList.name: NR Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the NR Cell Identity IE correspond to the gNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.1).

definitionList.name: E-UTRA CGI
descriptionList:
This IE is
used to globally identify an E-UTRA cell (see TS 36.300 [12]).

elementList.name: E-UTRA Cell Identity
elementList.description: The leftmost bits of the E-UTRA Cell Identity IE correspond to the ng-eNB ID (defined in subclause 9.2.2.2).

elementList.name: E-UTRA Cell Identity

The NR Frequency Info defines the carrier

elementList.description: RF Reference Frequency as defined in TS38.104 [24], section 5.4.2.1. The frequency provided in this IE identifies the absolute frequency position of the reference resource block (Common RB 0) of the carrier. Its lowest subcarrier is also known as Point A.

elementList.name: NR Frequency Band
elementList.description: Primary NR Operating Band as defined in TS38.104 [24], section 5.4.2.3. The value 1 corresponds e n1, value 2 corresponds to NR operating band n2, etc.

elementList.name: Supported SUL band Item

  NR cell. Value is 32.

elementList.name: NR NRB

definitionList.name: Global NG-RAN Cell Identity
descriptionList:
This IE contains either an NR or an E-UTRA
Cell Identity.

definitionList.name: Connectivity Support
descriptionList:
The Connectivity Support IE is used
to indicate the connectivity supported by a NR cell.

definitionList.name: Protected E-UTRA Resource Indication
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the resources allocated
for E-UTRA DL and UL reference and control signals (hereby referred to as
protected resources). This information is used in the process of E-UTRA – NR
Cell Resource Coordination.

elementList.name: Activation SFN
elementList.description: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the resource allocation is valid.

elementList.name: Protected Resource List
elementList.description: The protected resource pattern is continuously repeated, and it is valid until stated otherwise or until replaced by a new pattern. The pattern does not apply in reserved subframes.

elementList.name: Protected Resource List Item
elementList.description: Each item describes one transmission pattern. A pattern may comprise several control signals.

elementList.name: Resource Type
elementList.description: Indicates whether the protected resource is E-UTRA DL non-CRS, E-UTRA CRS or E-UTRA UL.

elementList.name: Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint
elementList.description: The bitmap of REs occupied by the protected signal within one PRB. Each position in the bitmap represents an RE in one PRB; value “0” indicates "resource not protected", value “1” indicates "resource protected ". The first bit of the string corresponds to the RE with the smallest time and frequency index in the PRB, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The length of the bit string equals the product of and the length of PRB in time dimension, measured in REs. is defined in TS 36.211 [10]. The intra-PRB pattern consisting of all “1”s is equivalent to PRB-level granularity.

elementList.name: Protected Footprint Frequency Pattern
elementList.description: The bit string indicates in which PRBs inside carrier bandwidth the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint applies. How often in time dimension this frequency pattern applies, depends on time periodicity of Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint. The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier bandwidth, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. Each position in the string represents a PRB; value “0” indicates " Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint does not appear in PRB", value “1” indicates "Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears in PRB". The length of the bit string equals the number of PRBs in the carrier bandwidth.

elementList.name: Protected Footprint Time Pattern
elementList.description: The description of time periodicity of the Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint.

elementList.name: Protected Footprint Time-periodicity
elementList.description: Periodicity with which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint repeats in time-dimension (1= every PRB (i.e. slot), 2=every other PRB (i.e. slot) etc.

elementList.name: Protected Footprint Start Time
elementList.description: The time-position of the PRB inside the frame in which the periodic Intra-PRB Protected Resource Footprint appears for the first time. The value “1” corresponds to the receiving node’s slot 0 in subframe 0 in the receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN.

elementList.name: MBSFN Control Region Length
elementList.description: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

elementList.name: PDCCH Region Length
elementList.description: Length of PDCCH region in regular subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. protected resource patterns. Value
  is 16.

definitionList.name: Data Traffic Resource Indication
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the intended data traffic
resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource Coordination.

elementList.name: Activation SFN
elementList.description: Indicates from which SFN of the receiving node the agreement is valid.

elementList.name: Reserved Subframe Pattern
elementList.description: Indicates subframes in which the resource allocation does not hold.

definitionList.name: Data Traffic Resources
descriptionList:
The Data Traffic Resources IE indicates
the intended data traffic resource allocation for E-UTRA - NR Cell Resource
Coordination.

elementList.name: Data Traffic Resources
elementList.description: The indication of resources allocated to E-UTRA PDSCH/PUSCH. Each position in the bit string represents a PRB pair in a subframe; value “0” indicates "resource not intended to be used for transmission", value “1” indicates "resource intended to be used for transmission ". The first bit of the bit string corresponds to the PRB pair occupying the lowest subcarrier frequencies of the carrier, where the indexing first goes into the frequency domain. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Data Traffic Resources IE corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The length of the bit string is an integer multiple of or , defined in TS 36.211 [10].

definitionList.name: Reserved Subframe Pattern
descriptionList:
The Reserved Subframe Pattern IE
indicates the pattern of subframes in which the Protected E-UTRA Resource
Indication and Data Traffic Resource Indication do not hold.

elementList.name: Subframe Type
elementList.description: Indicates what type of non-regular subframes the Reserved Subframe Pattern refers to (e.g. MBSFN).

elementList.name: Reserved Subframe Pattern
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a subframe. Value ‘0’ indicates “regular subframe”. Value ‘1’ indicates “reserved subframe”. For MBSFN subframes, the exception refers only to the non-control region of the subframe. The bit string may span across multiple contiguous subframes. The first position of the Subframe Configuration IE corresponds to the receiving node’s subframe 0 in a receiving node’s radio frame where SFN = Activation SFN. The IE is ignored if received by the ng-eNB.

elementList.name: MBSFN Control Region Length
elementList.description: Length of control region in MBSFN subframes. Expressed in REs, in the time dimension.

definitionList.name: Message Type
descriptionList:
The Message Type IE uniquely
identifies the message being sent. It is mandatory for all messages.

elementList.name: Type of Message
elementList.type: CHOICE (Initiating Message, Successful Outcome, Unsuccessful Outcome, …)

definitionList.name: Cause
descriptionList:
The purpose of the Cause IE is to
indicate the reason for a particular event for the NGAP protocol.

elementList.name: Radio Network Layer Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED ( Cell not Available, Handover Desirable for Radio Reasons, Handover Target not Allowed, Invalid AMF Region ID, No Radio Resources Available in Target Cell, Partial Handover, Reduce Load in Serving Cell, Resource Optimisation Handover, Time Critical Handover, TXnRELOCoverall Expiry, TXnRELOCprep Expiry, Unknown GUAMI ID, Unknown Local NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Inconsistent Remote NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID, Encryption And/Or Integrity Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Protection Algorithms Not Supported, Multiple PDU Session ID Instances, Unknown PDU Session ID, Unknown QoS Flow ID, Multiple QoS Flow ID Instances, Switch Off Ongoing, Not supported 5QI value, TXnDCoverall Expiry, TXnDCprep Expiry, Action Desirable for Radio Reasons, Reduce Load, Resource Optimisation, Time Critical action, Target not Allowed, No Radio Resources Available, Invalid QoS combination, Encryption Algorithms Not Supported, Procedure cancelled, RRM purpose, Improve User Bit Rate, User Inactivity, Radio Connection With UE Lost, Failure in the Radio Interface Procedure, Bearer Option not Supported, UP integrity protection not possible, UP confidentiality protection not possible, Resources not available for the slice, UE Maximum integrity protected data rate reason, Unspecified, …)

elementList.name: Protocol Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Transfer Syntax Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Reject), Abstract Syntax Error (Ignore and Notify), Message not Compatible with Receiver State, Semantic Error, Abstract Syntax Error (Falsely Constructed Message), Unspecified, …)

elementList.name: Miscellaneous Cause
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (Control Processing Overload, Hardware Failure, O&M Intervention, Not enough User Plane Processing Resources, Unspecified, …)

definitionList.name: Criticality Diagnostics
descriptionList:
The Criticality Diagnostics IE is
sent by the NG-RAN node when parts of a received message have not been
comprehended or were missing, or if the message contained logical errors. When
applicable, it contains information about which IEs were not comprehended or
were missing.

elementList.name: Procedure Code
elementList.description: Procedure Code is to be used if Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure, and not within the response message of the same procedure that caused the error.

elementList.name: Triggering Message
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (initiating message, successful outcome, unsuccessful outcome)
elementList.description: The Triggering Message is used only if the Criticality Diagnostics is part of Error Indication procedure.

elementList.name: Procedure Criticality
elementList.description: This Procedure Criticality is used for reporting the Criticality of the Triggering message (Procedure).

elementList.name: IE Criticality
elementList.description: The IE Criticality is used for reporting the criticality of the triggering IE. The value "ignore" shall not be used.

elementList.name: IE ID
elementList.description: The IE ID of the not understood or missing IE

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of IE errors allowed to be reported
  with a single message. The Value is 256.

definitionList.name: Bit Rate
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the number of bits
delivered by NG-RAN in UL or to NG-RAN in DL within a period of time, divided
by the duration of the period. It is used, for example, to indicate the maximum
or guaranteed bit rate for a GBR QoS flow, or an aggregate maximum bit rate.

elementList.name: Bit Rate
elementList.description: The unit is: bit/s

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Level QoS Parameters
descriptionList:
This IE defines the QoS Parameters to be
applied to a QoS flow.

elementList.name: Allocation and Retention Priority
elementList.description: Note: presence needs to be checked with latest SA2 status, hence this IE definition may need to be refined.

elementList.name: GBR QoS Flow Information
elementList.description: This IE shall be present for GBR QoS Flows only.

elementList.name: Reflective QoS Attribute
elementList.description: Reflective QoS is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE applies to non-GBR bearers only and shall be ignored otherwise.

elementList.name: Additional QoS flow Information
elementList.description: If this IE is set to "more likely", this indicates that traffic for this QoS flow is likely to appear more often than traffic for other flows established for the PDU session. This IE may be present in case of non-GBR flows only and shall be ignored otherwise.

definitionList.name: GBR QoS Flow Information
descriptionList:
This IE indicates QoS Parameters for a GBR
QoS Flow for downlink and uplink.

elementList.name: Maximum Flow Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Maximum Bit Rate in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Maximum Flow Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Maximum Bit Rate in UL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver) in DL. Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Guaranteed Flow Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Guaranteed Bit Rate (provided that there is data to deliver). Flow Bit Rates are specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Notification Control
elementList.description: Notification control is specified in TS 23.501 [7]

elementList.name: Maximum Packet Loss Rate Downlink
elementList.description: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the downlink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Maximum Packet Loss Rate Uplink
elementList.description: Indicates the maximum rate for lost packets that can be tolerated in the uplink direction. Maximum Packet Loss Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

definitionList.name: Allocation and Retention Priority
descriptionList:
This IE specifies the relative importance
compared to other QoS flows for allocation and retention of the NR RAN
resource.

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Desc.: This defines the relative importance of a resource request. (see TS 23.501 [7]). Usage: Values between 1 and 15 are ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e., 1 is the highest and 15 is the lowest.

elementList.name: Pre-emption Capability
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (shall not trigger pre-emption, may trigger pre-emption, ...)
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the pre-emption capability of the request on other QoS flows Usage: The QoS flow shall not pre-empt other QoS flow or, the QoS flow may pre-empt other QoS flows The Pre-emption Capability indicator applies to the allocation of resources for a QoS flow and as such it provides the trigger to the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

elementList.name: Pre-emption Vulnerability
elementList.description: Desc.: This IE indicates the vulnerability of the QoS flow to preemption of other QoS flows. Usage: The QoS flow shall not be pre-empted by other QoS flows or the QoS flow may be pre-empted by other QoS flows. Pre-emption Vulnerability indicator applies for the entire duration of the QoS flow, unless modified and as such indicates whether the QoS flow is a target of the pre-emption procedures/processes of the gNB.

definitionList.name: Non dynamic 5QI Descriptor
descriptionList:
This IE defines QoS
characteristics for a standardized or pre-configured 5QI for downlink and
uplink.

elementList.name: 5QI
elementList.description: This IE contains the standardized or pre-configured 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7}

elementList.name: Priority level
elementList.description: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value.

elementList.name: Averaging window
elementList.description: This IE applies to GBR QoS Flows only. Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value.

elementList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
elementList.description: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. When included, it overrides standardized or pre-configured value. If the 5QI refers to a non delay critical QoS flow the IE shall be ignored.

definitionList.name: Dynamic 5QI Descriptor
descriptionList:
This IE defines the QoS characteristics for a non-standardized or not pre-configured 5QI
for downlink and uplink.

elementList.name: Priority level
elementList.description: Priority level is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Packet Delay Budget
elementList.description: Packet Delay Budget is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Packet Error Rate
elementList.description: Packet Error Rate is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: 5QI
elementList.description: This IE contains the dynamically assigned 5QI as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Delay Critical
elementList.description: This IE indicates whether the GBR Qos flow is delay critical as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Averaging window
elementList.description: Averaging window is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
elementList.description: Maximum Data Burst Volume is specified in TS 23.501 [7]. This IE shall be included if the Delay Critical IE is set to "delay critical" and shall be ignored otherwise.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be
  present if the GBR QoS Flow Information IE is present in the QoS
  Flow Level QoS Parameters IE.

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Indicator
descriptionList:
This IE identifies
a QoS Flow within a PDU Session. Definition and use of the QoS Flow Indicator
is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

definitionList.name: Packet Loss Rate
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Packet Loss Rate for a QoS
flow.

elementList.name: Packet Loss Rate
elementList.description: Ratio of lost packets per number of packets sent, expressed in tenth of percent.

definitionList.name: Packet Delay Budget
descriptionList: This IE indicates the Packet Delay Budget for a QoS flow.

elementList.name: Packet Delay Budget
elementList.description: Upper bound value for the delay that a packet may experience expressed in units of 0.5ms.

definitionList.name: Packet Error Rate
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Packet Error Rate for
a QoS flow.

elementList.name: Scalar
elementList.description: The packet error rate is expressed as Scalar * 10-k, whereas k is the Exponent.

definitionList.name: Averaging Window
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Averaging Window for
a QoS flow.

elementList.name: Averaging Window
elementList.description: Unit: ms.

definitionList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Maximum Data Burst
Volume for a QoS flow.

elementList.name: Maximum Data Burst Volume
elementList.description: Unit: byte,

definitionList.name: NG-RAN node UE XnAP ID
descriptionList:
The NG-RAN
node UE XnAP ID uniquely identifies a UE over the Xn interface within the
NG-RAN node.

The use of this IE is defined in TS 38.401
[2].

definitionList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
descriptionList:
The UE Aggregate Maximum Bitrate is
applicable for all Non-GBR QoS flows per UE which is defined for the Downlink
and the Uplink direction and a subscription parameter provided by the AMF to
the NG-RAN.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: Applicable for Non-GBR QoS flows.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the downlink direction.

elementList.name: UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the UE Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the uplink direction.

definitionList.name: PDU Session ID
descriptionList:
This IE
identifies a PDU Session for a UE. Definition and use of the PDU Session ID is
specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: PDU Session ID
elementList.description: The value range of this IE may need to be refined.

definitionList.name: PDU Session Type
descriptionList:
This IE
defines the PDU Session Type as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

definitionList.name: TAI Support List
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the list of TAIs
supported by NG-RAN node and associated characteristics e.g. supported slices.

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Broadcast TAC

elementList.name: PLMN Identity
elementList.description: Broadcast PLMN

elementList.name: TAI Slice Support List
elementList.description: Supported S-NSSAIs per TA

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of TACs supported by an NG-RAN
  node. Value is 1024. This IE may need to be refined.

Maximum no. of PLMNs supported by an NG-RAN
  node. Value is 16. This IE may need to be refined.

definitionList.name: S-NSSAI
descriptionList: This IE indicates the S-NSSAI.

definitionList.name: Slice Support List
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the list of supported
slices.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of signalled slice support items.
  Value is 1024.

definitionList.name: Index to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority
descriptionList:
The Index
to RAT/Frequency Selection Priority IE is used to define local
configuration for RRM strategies such as camp priorities and control of
inter-RAT/inter-frequency mobility in RRC_CONNECTED, as specified in TS 23.501
[7].

definitionList.name: GUAMI
descriptionList:
This IE contains the Globally Unique AMF
Identifier (GUAMI) as defined in TS 23.003 [22].

definitionList.name: Target Cell Global ID
descriptionList:
This IE contains either an NR CGI or an
E-UTRA CGI.

definitionList.name: AMF UE NGAP ID
descriptionList:
This IE is
defined in TS 38.413 [5] and used to refer to the UE Context in the serving
AMF.

elementList.name: AMF UE NGAP ID
elementList.description: As defined in TS 38.413 [5].

definitionList.name: SCG Configuration Query
descriptionList:
The SCG Configuration Query IE is used
to request the S-NG-RAN node to provide current SCG configuration.

definitionList.name: RLC Mode
descriptionList:
The RLC Mode IE indicates the RLC
Mode used for a DRB.

definitionList.name: Transport Layer Address
descriptionList:
This IE is
defined to contain an IP address.

definitionList.name: UP Transport Layer Information
descriptionList:
This element is used to provide the
transport layer information associated with NG or Xn user plane
transport. In this release it
corresponds to an IP adress and a GTP Tunnel Endpoint Identifier.

elementList.name: Transport Layer Address
elementList.description: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20].

elementList.name: GTP-TEID
elementList.description: The Tunnel Endpoint Identifier (TEID) is specified in TS 29.281 [18]

definitionList.name: CP Transport Layer Information
descriptionList:
This element is used to provide the
transport layer information associated with NG or Xn control plane
transport.

elementList.name: Endpoint IP Address Address
elementList.description: The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.424 [19] and TS 38.414 [20].The Transport Layer Address is specified in TS 38.422 [4] and TS 38.412 [21].

definitionList.name: Masked IMEISV
descriptionList:
This information element contains the IMEISV value with a mask, to identify a
terminal model without identifying an individual Mobile Equipment.

elementList.name: Masked IMEISV
elementList.description: Coded as the International Mobile station Equipment Identity and Software Version Number (IMEISV) defined in TS 23.003 [22] with the last 4 digits of the SNR masked by setting the corresponding bits to 1.

definitionList.name: DRB ID
descriptionList:
This IE contains
the DRB ID.

definitionList.name: DL Forwarding
descriptionList:
This element indicates a proposal for
forwarding of downlink packets.

definitionList.name: Data Forwarding Accepted
descriptionList:
This element indicates that data forwarding
was accepted.

definitionList.name: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 12
descriptionList:
This information element indicates the
12-bit long PDCP sequence number and the corresponding 20 bit long Hyper Frame
Number.

definitionList.name: COUNT Value for PDCP SN Length 18
descriptionList:
This information element indicates the
18-bit long PDCP sequence number and the corresponding 14 bit long Hyper Frame
Number.

definitionList.name: RAN Paging Area
descriptionList:
The RAN Paging
Area IE defines the paging area within a PLMN for RAN paging a UE
in RRC_INACTIVE state.

elementList.name: NG-RAN Cell Identity
elementList.description: In this version of the specification, the RAN paging area should contain NG-RAN cells of the same RAT type.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of cells in a RAN notification area. Value is 32.

Maximum no. of RAN area
  IDs in a RAN notification area. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: RAN Area ID
descriptionList: This IE defines the RAN Area ID.

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: Tracking Area Code

definitionList.name: UE Context ID
descriptionList: This IE is used to address a UE Context within an NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: I-RNTI
elementList.description: How the new NG-RAN node is able to resolve the old NG-RAN ID from the I-RNTI is a matter of proper configuration in the old and new NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: C-RNTI
elementList.description: C-RNTI contained in the RRCReestablishmentRequest message (TS 38.331 [10]) or RRCConnectionReestablishmentRequest message (TS 36.331 [14]).

definitionList.name: Assistance Data for RAN Paging
descriptionList: This IE provides assistance information for RAN paging.

definitionList.name: RAN Paging Attempt Information
descriptionList:
This IE includes information related to the
RAN paging attempt over Xn.

elementList.name: Paging Attempt Count
elementList.description: Number of the RAN paging attempt.

elementList.name: Intended Number of Paging Attempts
elementList.description: Intended number of RAN paging attempts.

elementList.name: Next Paging Area Scope
elementList.description: Indicates whether the RAN paging area scope will change at next RAN paging attempt.

definitionList.name: UE RAN Paging Identity
descriptionList:
The IE
defines the UE Identity for RAN paging a UE in RRC_INACTIVE.

definitionList.name: Paging Priority
descriptionList:
This
information element contains an indication of the priority to be considered for
the paging request.

elementList.name: Paging Priority
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (PrioLevel1, PrioLevel2, PrioLevel3, PrioLevel4, PrioLevel5, PrioLevel6, PrioLevel7, PrioLevel8, ...)
elementList.description: Lower value codepoint indicates higher priority.

definitionList.name: Delivery Status
descriptionList:
This IE provides the delivery status of RRC
PDUs provided by RRC Transfer message.

elementList.name: Delivery Status
elementList.description: Highest successfully delivered NR PDCP SN, as defined in TS 38.323 [11].

definitionList.name: I-RNTI
descriptionList:
The I-RNTI
is defined for allocation in an NR or E-UTRA serving cell as a reference to a
UE Context within an NG-RAN node.

definitionList.name: Location Reporting Information
descriptionList:
This information element indicates how the
location information should be reported.

elementList.name: Event Type
elementList.type: ENUMERATED ( report upon change of serving cell, report UE moving presence into or out of the Area of Interest, …)

definitionList.name: Area of Interest
descriptionList:
This IE
indicates the area of interest.

elementList.name: List of Cells
elementList.description: This IE may need to be refined with SA2.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of areas of interest. Value is 64.

Maximum no. of tracking
  areas in an area of interest. Value is 16.

Maximum no. of cells in an Area of Interest.
  Value is 256. This value may need to be refined.

Maximum no. of global NG-RAN nodes in an Area
  of Interest. Value is 64.

definitionList.name: UE Security Capabilities
descriptionList:
The UE Security Capabilities IE
defines the supported algorithms for encryption and integrity protection in the
UE.

elementList.name: NR Encryption Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: “all bits equal to 0” – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NEA0, “first bit” – 128-NEA1, “second bit” – 128-NEA2, “third bit” – 128-NEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.501 [28].

elementList.name: NR Integrity Protection Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: “all bits equal to 0” – UE supports no other NR algorithm than NIA0, “first bit” – 128-NIA1, “second bit” – 128-NIA2, “third bit” – 128-NIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.501 [28].

elementList.name: E-UTRA Encryption Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an encryption algorithm: “all bits equal to 0” – UE supports no other algorithm than EEA0, “first bit” – 128-EEA1, “second bit” – 128-EEA2, “third bit” – 128-EEA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [29].

elementList.name: E-UTRA Integrity Protection Algorithms
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an integrity protection algorithm: “all bits equal to 0” – UE supports no other algorithm than EIA0, “first bit” – 128-EIA1, “second bit” – 128-EIA2, “third bit” – 128-EIA3, other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates support and value ‘0’ indicates no support of the algorithm. Algorithms are defined in TS 33.401 [29].

definitionList.name: AS Security Information
descriptionList:
The AS Security
Information IE is used to generate the key material to
be used for AS security with the UE.

elementList.name: Key NG-RAN Star
elementList.description: KNG-RAN* defined in TS 33.501 [28].

elementList.name: Next Hop Chaining Count
elementList.description: Next Hop Chaining Count (NCC) defined in TS 33.501 [28]

definitionList.name: S-NG-RAN node Security Key
descriptionList:
The S-NG-RAN node Security Key
IE is used to apply security in the S-NG-RAN node as defined in TS 33.501 [28].

elementList.name: S-NG-RAN node Security Key
elementList.description: The S-KSN which is provided by the M-NG-RAN node, see TS 33.501 [28].

definitionList.name: Security Indication
descriptionList:
This IE indicates whether the UP integrity is
configured for corresponding PDU sessions, respectively.

elementList.name: Integrity Protection Indication
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP integrity protection shall apply, should apply, or shall not apply for the concerned PDU session.

elementList.name: Confidentiality Protection Indication
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP ciphering shall apply, should apply, or shall not apply for the concerned PDU session.

conditionList.explanation:
This IE shall be present if the Integrity
  Protection IE within the Security Indication IE is present and set
  to “required” or “preferred”.

definitionList.name: Mobility Restriction List
descriptionList:
This IE defines roaming or access
restrictions for subsequent mobility actions for which the NR-RAN provides
information about the target of the mobility action towards the UE, e.g.,
handover, or for SCG selection during dual connectivity operation or for
assigning proper RNAs. If the NG-RAN receives the Mobility Restriction List IE,
it shall overwrite previously received restriction information. NG-RAN
behaviour upon receiving this IE is specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: Equivalent PLMNs
elementList.description: Allowed PLMNs in addition to Serving PLMN. This list corresponds to the list of “equivalent PLMNs” as defined in TS 24.501 [30]. This list is part of the roaming restriction information. Roaming restrictions apply to PLMNs other than the Serving PLMN and Equivalent PLMNs.

elementList.name: RAT Restrictions
elementList.description: This IE contains RAT restriction related information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: RAT Restriction Information
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents a RAT. If a bit is set to "1", the respective RAT is restricted for the UE. If a bit is set to "0", the respective RAT is not restricted for the UE. This version of the specification does not use bits 2-7, the sending node shall set bits 2-7 to "0", the sender shall ignore bits 2-7.

elementList.name: Forbidden Area Information
elementList.description: This IE contains Forbidden Area information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: The TAC of the forbidden TAI.

elementList.name: Service Area Information
elementList.description: This IE contains Service Area Restriction information as specified in TS 23.501 [7].

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: The TAC of the allowed TAI.

elementList.name: TAC
elementList.description: The TAC of the not-allowed TAI.

rangeBoundList.explanation: Maximum no. of equivalent PLMNs. Value is 15.
Maximum no. of allowed PLMNs. Value is 16.

Maximum no. of forbidden Tracking Area Codes.
  Value is 4096.

Maximum no. of allowed or not allowed Tracking
  Areas. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: Xn Benefit Value
descriptionList:
The Xn Benefit Value IE indicates
the quantified benefit of the signalling connection.

elementList.name: Xn Benefit Value
elementList.description: Value 1 indicates lowest benefit, and 8 indicates highest benefit.

definitionList.name: Trace Activation
descriptionList:
This IE
defines parameters related to a trace activation.

elementList.name: NG-RAN Trace ID
elementList.description: This IE is composed of the following: Trace Reference defined in TS 32.422 [23] (leftmost 6 octets, with PLMN information encoded as in 9.2.2.4), and Trace Recording Session Reference defined in TS 32.422 [23] (last 2 octets).

elementList.name: Interfaces To Trace
elementList.description: Each position in the bitmap represents an NG-RAN node interface: first bit = NG-C, second bit = Xn-C, third bit = Uu, fourth bit = F1-C, fifth bit = E1: other bits reserved for future use. Value ‘1’ indicates ‘should be traced’. Value ‘0’ indicates ‘should not be traced’.

elementList.name: Trace Depth
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (minimum, medium, maximum, MinimumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MediumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, MaximumWithoutVendorSpecificExtension, …)
elementList.description: Defined in TS 32.422 [23].

elementList.name: Trace Collection Entity IP Address
elementList.description: Defined in TS 32.422 [23]

definitionList.name: Time To Wait
descriptionList:
This IE defines the minimum allowed waiting
times.

definitionList.name: QoS Flow Notification Control Indication Info
descriptionList:
This IE provides information about QoS
flows of a PDU Session Resource enabled with notification control.

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum no. of QoS flows allowed within one
  PDU session. Value is 64.

definitionList.name: Location Reporting Reference ID
descriptionList:
This IE contains the Location Reporting
Reference ID.

definitionList.name: User plane traffic activity report
descriptionList:
This IE is used to indicate user plane traffic
activity.
NOTE: This IE may need to be refined.

elementList.name: User plane traffic activity report
elementList.description: "re-activated" shall be only set after "inactive" has been reported for the concerned reporting object

definitionList.name: Lower Layer presence status change
descriptionList:
This IE is used to indicate that lower
layer resources’ presence status shall be changed. If the presence status is
set to "release lower layers", SDAP entities, PDCP entities, Xn-U bearer resources, NG-U bearer
resources and UE context information shall be kept.
NOTE: This IE may need to be refined.

elementList.name: Lower Layer presence status change
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (release lower layers, re-establish lower layers, ...)
elementList.description: "re-establish lower layers" shall be only set after "release lower layers" has been indicated.

definitionList.name: RRC Resume Cause
descriptionList:
The purpose of the RRC Resume Cause
IE is to indicate to the old NG-RAN node the reason for the RRC Connection
Resume as received from the UE in the ResumeCause defined in TS 36.331
[14] and TS 38.331 [10]. In this version of the specification, this is limited
to the case of RNA update.

definitionList.name: Priority Level
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Priority Level for a
QoS flow.

elementList.name: Priority Level
elementList.description: Values ordered in decreasing order of priority, i.e. with 1 as the highest priority and 127 as the lowest priority.

definitionList.name: PDCP SN Length
descriptionList:
The PDCP SN Length IE is used to indicate
the PDCP SN length configuration of the bearer.

elementList.name: PDCP SN Length
elementList.description: This IE indicates the PDCP sequence number size.

definitionList.name: UE History Information
descriptionList:
The UE History Information IE
contains information about cells that a UE has been served by in active state
prior to the target cell. The overall mechanism is described in TS 36.300 [12].

NOTE:      The definition of this IE is aligned
with the definition of the UE History Information IE in TS 38.413 [5].

elementList.name: Last Visited Cell List
elementList.description: Most recent information is added to the top of this list

rangeBoundList.explanation:
Maximum number of last visited cell information
  records that can be reported in the IE. Value is 16.

definitionList.name: Last Visited Cell Information
descriptionList:
The Last Visited Cell Information may
contain cell specific information.

elementList.name: Last Visited NG-RAN Cell Information
elementList.description: Defined in TS 38.413 [5].

elementList.name: Last Visited E-UTRAN Cell Information
elementList.description: Defined in TS 36.413 [31].

elementList.name: Last Visited UTRAN Cell Information
elementList.description: Defined in TS 25.413 [32].

elementList.name: Last Visited GERAN Cell Information
elementList.description: Defined in TS 36.413 [31].

definitionList.name: Paging DRX
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the Paging DRX as defined
in TS 38.304 [33].

definitionList.name: Security Result
descriptionList:
This IE indicates
whether the security policy indicated as “preferred” in the Security
Indication IE is performed or not.

elementList.name: Integrity Protection Result
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP integrity protection is performed or not for the concerned PDU session.

elementList.name: Confidentiality Protection Result
elementList.description: Indicates whether UP ciphering is performed or not for the concerned PDU session.

definitionList.name: UE Context Kept Indicator
descriptionList:
This IE indicates
whether the UE Context is kept at the S-NG-RAN node in case of an M-NG-RAN node
handover without S-NG-RAN node change.

definitionList.name: PDU Session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
descriptionList:
This IE is applicable for all non-GBR QoS
flows per PDU session which is defined for the downlink and the uplink
direction and is provided by the SMF to the NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate
elementList.description: Applicable for Non-GBR QoS flows.

elementList.name: PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Downlink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the downlink direction.

elementList.name: PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate Uplink
elementList.description: This IE indicates the PDU session Aggregate Maximum Bit Rate as specified in TS 23.501 [7] in the uplink direction.

definitionList.name: LCID
descriptionList:
This IE uniquely identifies a logicall
channel ID for the associated DRB.

elementList.name: LCID
elementList.description: Corresponds to the LogicalChannelIdentity defined in TS 38.331 [10].

definitionList.name: Duplication activation
descriptionList:
The Duplication Activation IE
indicates whether UL PDCP Duplication is activated or not.

definitionList.name: RRC Config Indication
descriptionList:
This IE indicates the type of RRC
configuration used at the S-NG-RAN node.

definitionList.name: Maximum Integrity Protected Data Rate
descriptionList:
This IE
indicates the maximum aggregate data rate for integrity protected DRBs for a UE
as defined in TS 38.300 [9].

elementList.name: Maximum IP Rate
elementList.description: Defines the upper bound of the aggregated data rate of user plane integrity protected data. This limit applies to both UL and DL independently.

definitionList.name: PDCP Change Indication
descriptionList:
The PDCP Change Indication IE is used for S-NG-RAN
node to either initiate the security key update or to request PDCP data
recovery in M-NG-RAN node. The PDCP Change Indication IE is also used for M-NG-RAN
node to request PDCP data recovery in S-NG-RAN node.

elementList.name: Indication from S-NG-RAN node to M-NG-RAN node
elementList.type: ENUMERATED (S-NG-RAN node key update required, PDCP data recovery required, ...)
elementList.description: S-NG-RAN node key update required indicates that the security key in S-NG-RAN node needs to be updated. The value of PDCP data recovery required indicates that the M-NG-RAN node needs to perform PDCP data recovery.

elementList.name: Indication from M-NG-RAN node to S-NG-RAN node
elementList.description: The value of PDCP data recovery required indicates that the S-NG-RAN node needs to perform PDCP data recovery.
